definition: to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: The two opposing armies are locked in battle.
As nobles, these men would of course ride to battle, but many would fight dismounted.
sentences.chinese: 這些貴族部隊雖然騎馬行軍，但極爲熱衷步戰廝殺。

sentences.english: Dismounted, they make solid infantry armed with light spears.
sentences.chinese: 步行波蘭貴族騎兵熱衷步戰廝殺，使用標槍作戰。

sentences.english: Coral reefs, however, are also natural battlefields.
sentences.chinese: 然而，珊瑚礁也是自然界廝殺的戰場。

sentences.english: The party defeated the helmet of rejected will inevitably, flying for lost.
sentences.chinese: 廝殺結果，打敗的一方免不了會棄盔丟甲，飛奔逃命。

sentences.english: Despite preferring to fight on horseback, these heavily armoured archers have dismounted to fight on foot.
sentences.chinese: 重裝弓騎兵儘管鍾愛騎馬廝殺，但有時亦會步行作戰。

sentences.english: The candidates slugged it out in a series of debates.
sentences.chinese: 參選者們在一連串的辯論中猛烈廝殺。

sentences.english: When the animal slaughters mutually gnaws, is stems from the instinct to make the negative behavior.
sentences.chinese: 當動物互相廝殺啃噬，是出於本能地做出負面行爲。

sentences.english: Cause this battle between sisters confidential director leaves GongJin again?
sentences.chinese: 引起姐妹之間這場廝殺的保密處長葉公瑾又何去何從？

sentences.english: Its TV and digital camera units are struggling.
sentences.chinese: 電視和數碼相機業務還處於廝殺中。

sentences.english: Soldiers would come face to face with one another to fight.
sentences.chinese: 軍人們會面對面捉對廝殺。

sentences.english: With his excellent archery, Lü averted a fight between the two sides.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣，呂布以他精湛的箭法平息了一場廝殺。

sentences.english: No flag of truce possible. Men are willing to die, provided their opponent will kill them.
sentences.chinese: 對戰敗者不饒命，沒有談判的可能，人們拼死廝殺。

sentences.english: And the pair lock horns at Goodison at lunchtime today.
sentences.chinese: 兩隊今天中午將在古迪遜展開激烈廝殺。

sentences.english: They cut down the forests and they cut each other's throats with equal energy.
sentences.chinese: 他們也以同樣的精力相互廝殺，割斷對手的喉嚨。

sentences.english: These Irish squires are prepared to work for the master who can pay them best.
sentences.chinese: 這些愛爾蘭騎兵隨時願意爲金錢效命廝殺。

definition: to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to match one's strength with/to compete/more competitive/to set oneself against sb/disobliging/to make a special effort
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
